alert.note: Alert for Alleghany; Ashe; Wilkes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 15 at 1:49AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHWESTERN ALLEGHANY...WILKES AND SOUTHEASTERN ASHE COUNTIES IN NORTHWESTERN NORTH CAROLINA THROUGH 215 AM EDT... At 149 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Glendale Springs to near Millers Creek to near Elkville. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... North Wilkesboro... Wilkesboro... Laurel Springs... Boomer... Glendale Springs... Wilbar... and Mc Grady. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM EDT for northwestern North Carolina...and southwestern Virginia.
